page.title: 18SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: Kinloch house was gifted by the Hutchison family to the Church of Scotland to be used as a residential home for the elderly. There are 44 residents living in the house: 10 men and 34 women. The residents share rooms with 2_3 occupants though some have their own rooms. The house has a total of 28 staff which comprises of :_ 6 night staff; 6 day staff; 8 domestics; 3 officers in charge; 2 cooks and 3 week_end workers. The problem of caring for the elderly is likely to increase in the future as the proportion of the population which is over pensionable age increases. Local Authorites in N.E. Fife have invested heavily to provide accommodation for old people in sheltered housing and old peoples' homes in local towns such as Cupar and Auchtermuchty.
